p: Piperitone oxide or piperitone are monoterpenes that have been described as major components of the essential oils of species of the genus Hyptis spp., Mentha spp. and Clinopodium odorum [ 12, 13, 14]. This first monoterpene is a clear, slightly yellowish liquid, chemically termed 3-isopropyl-6-methyl-7-oxa-bicyclo [4.1.0] heptan-2-one of molecular formula C 10H 14O 2 and molecular weight 166.21. It is soluble in water and organic solvent. Piperitone is derived from the metabolic pathway for the formation of piperitenone oxide, in which cis-pulegone is also derived [ 15, 16] reported that this terpene has three organic functions in its chemical structure and can be used for the synthesis of other compounds.
